title: Kezie Apps
text:
Kezie Apps (born 4 February 1991) is an Australian <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a for the <a href="St%20George%20Illawarra%20Dragons">St George Illawarra Dragons</a> in the <a href="NRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NRL Women's Premiership</a> and the <a href="Helensburgh%20Tigers">Helensburgh Tigers</a> in the <a href="NSWRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NSWRL Women's Premiership</a>.
She is an <a href="Australian%20Jillaroos">Australian</a> international and <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20women%27s%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a> representative.
Background.
Born in <a href="Bega%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Bega, New South Wales</a>, Apps played her junior rugby league for the <a href="Bega%20Roosters">Bega Roosters</a> alongside current <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne Storm</a> player <a href="Dale%20Finucane">Dale Finucane</a>. 
At age 12, she was forced to stop playing due to age restrictions that were in place. Her older brother <a href="Deon%20Apps">Deon</a>, played two games for the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> in 2011.
Playing career.
In 2014, Apps returned to rugby league, joining the <a href="Helensburgh%20Tigers">Helensburgh Tigers</a> women's side. Later that year, she made her debut for <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20women%27s%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a> in the annual Women's Interstate Challenge against <a href="Queensland%20women%27s%20rugby%20league%20team">Queensland</a> and <a href="Australian%20Jillaroos">Australia</a> in their <a href="2014%20Rugby%20League%20Four%20Nations">Four Nations</a> curtain-raiser against <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20women%27s%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a>. At the end of the season, she was named the Illawarra Women's Player of the Year and the <a href="NSWRL">NSWRL</a> Women's Player of the Year.
In 2015, she made her debut for the Women's All Star side in their <a href="2015%20All%20Stars%20match">annual fixture</a> against the <a href="Indigenous%20All-Stars%20%28rugby%20league%29">Indigenous All Stars</a>.
On 28 September 2016, she won the women's Dally M Medal for Player of the Year at the <a href="2016%20Dally%20M%20Awards">Dally M awards</a>.
In October 2017, she was named in <a href="Australian%20Jillaroos">Australia</a>'s <a href="2017%20Women%27s%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">2017 Women's Rugby League World Cup</a> squad. On 2 December, she started at second row in the Jillaroos 23-16 <a href="2017%20Women%27s%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup%20Final">final</a> win over the <a href="New%20Zealand%20women%27s%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a>.
In June 2018, Apps, along with Sam Bremner and Talesha Quinn, were named as the three marquee players for the <a href="St.%20George%20Illawarra%20Dragons%23NRL%20Women%27s%20team">St. George Illawarra Dragons women's team</a> which will commence playing in the <a href="NRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NRL Women's Premiership</a> starting in September.
On 6 October 2019, she captained the Dragons in their 6–30 <a href="2019%20NRL%20Grand%20Final">Grand Final</a> loss to the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a>.
